title: Are Plato and Aristotle the same person? - Quora

response.answer_text: What’s puzzling is why you might think they ARE the same person. Plato was Aristotle’s teacher; he was about 40 years older than Aristotle. Usually when we ask such questions it’s because of stylistic similarities between two writers of the same time period. There are no stylistic similarities between Plato’s dialogues and Aristotle’s treatises. Not only does Aristotle criticize Plato’s doctrines, his own are in most respects very different.

No. One could say that Plato and Socrates were, if only because we only know of Socrates mostly Plato’s works, and Plato, in all likelihood, used Socrates as a mouthpiece for his own ideas. Aristotle studied at Plato’s Academy, then started his own school, the Lyceum. But Aristotle and Plato are most assuredly *not* the same person, mainly because many of their ideas were and are in conflict.
No. Aristotle started as a student of Plato, but left to form his own school. Philosophically, they are almost polar opposites.
